channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Covid: EU drugs regulator approves AstraZeneca vaccine
item.description: The European Medicines Agency approves use of the AstraZeneca Covid vaccine for use across the bloc.

item.title: Coronavirus: EU confirms export controls on vaccines
item.description: The controls will apply to vaccines made within the bloc, amid a shortfall in deliveries.

item.title: What's been going on at GameStop?
item.description: Chris Fox explains stocks, short-selling and what has been happening with GameStop shares.

item.title: Kate on children's 'horror' at her lockdown haircuts
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge tells fellow parents about how she's handling lockdown with her three children.

item.title: Louisiana cemetery 'sorry' after denying officer burial 'because he is black'
item.description: A Louisiana cemetery removed a white burials only rule after a local policeman was denied a plot.

item.title: Israeli archaeologists find 'Biblical royal purple dye'
item.description: The rare purple was said to be worn by prestigious figures such as King David, Solomon and Jesus.

item.title: China warns Taiwan independence 'means war' as US pledges support
item.description: The warning comes days after China stepped up military activities near the self-governed island.

item.title: Covid: New Zealand quarantine hotel worker sacked after ‘inappropriate encounter’
item.description: A quarantine hotel employee spent 20 minutes in a room with someone who should have been isolating.

item.title: Shell Nigeria ordered to pay compensation for oil spills
item.description: The oil giant's Nigerian subsidiary is ordered to pay compensation to farmers.

item.title: Pioneering US actress Cicely Tyson dies aged 96
item.description: She was known for playing strong African-American characters during a career spanning seven decades.

item.title: France murders: Man with hatred for HR suspected in attacks
item.description: The suspect is linked to four attacks targeting human resources managers and a job centre adviser.

item.title: UK stands firm over special visa for Hong Kong residents
item.description: China says a UK visa, which some Hong Kongers can apply for, "grossly interferes" in its affairs.

item.title: The Weeknd: Grammys 'mean nothing to me' after nominations snub
item.description: The Blinding Lights singer, who is preparing for his Super Bowl gig, is over his nominations snub.

item.title: How New Zealand band Six60 are playing to up to 30,000 fans
item.description: While concerts around the world are on hold, New Zealand band Six60 are playing to big audiences.

item.title: 'Profound relief and joy' as 'Muslim ban' lifted
item.description: Activists celebrated Biden's rescinding of the so-called "Muslim ban" but vowed to keep fighting.

item.title: Why roller-skating is making a comeback
item.description: It's become so popular in the past year that there's now a worldwide shortage of skates.

item.title: 'Less exercise, more TV' in UK's latest lockdown
item.description: People are spending less time on hobbies and volunteering in the current lockdown, researchers say.

item.title: The story behind the inauguration's sign language Pledge of Allegiance
item.description: Fire Captain Andrea Hall stole the show - and there is a personal story behind her unique pledge.

item.title: Quad Gods: The world-class gamers who play with their mouths
item.description: How disabled gamers formed a winning esports team called the Quad Gods.

item.title: Royal Family documentary briefly resurfaces online
item.description: The film, which was first shown 50 years ago and locked away, re-appeared this month on YouTube.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 21-28 January 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: Ralph Fiennes and Carey Mulligan remake history in Netflix film The Dig
item.description: Ralph Fiennes and Carey Mulligan discuss history, archaeology, Indiana Jones and their new film.

item.title: Climate activists 'celebrating key victories'
item.description: Two young US campaigners react to the Biden administration's proposals on fighting climate change.

item.title: Covid: Living through lockdown in a high-rise flat
item.description: The continuing lockdown in England is tough for everyone but what's it like if you have limited space at home?

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines: Is it OK to get a leftover jab?
item.description: As vaccines are rolled out, questions have been raised about how spares should be allocated.

item.title: Satellite boom attracts technology giants
item.description: Tech giants promise faster, wider access to data thanks to cheaper satellite launches.

item.title: US-Mexico border: The gruesome attack that shocked a village
item.description: Families look for answers after 19 people were killed then set alight on the US-Mexico border.

item.title: Can striking oil turn Cambodia's economy around?
item.description: The country's first oil project has finally started pumping the black gold after 15 years of false starts.

item.title: UK BNO visa: Can Hong Kong residents now live in the UK?
item.description: Millions of people in Hong Kong will have new opportunities to live and work in the UK.

item.title: Covid: Are teachers more at risk of dying?
item.description: Labour's Angela Rayner has suggested teachers are "more at risk of infection and death" from the virus.

item.title: Chinese New Year: Clamping down on going home for the holidays
item.description: China is striving to curtail the world's biggest mass migration event when people go home to see family.

item.title: Debutant Nauman takes 5-35 as Pakistan beat South Africa
item.description: Debutant Nauman Ali claims 5-35 as Pakistan wrap up a seven-wicket win over South Africa with a day to spare in the first Test in Karachi.

item.title: Ibrahimovic and Lukaku get one-match bans after Coppa Italia clash
item.description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Romelu Lukaku are given a one-match bans after their confrontation in Tuesday's Milan derby.

item.title: Kylian Mbappe: Will PSG striker leave France for Real Madrid?
item.description: PSG striker Kylian Mbappe has been linked to Real Madrid for most of his professional career, but could he sign a new contract to commit his future to the French club?

item.title: 'As a black woman, I basically take a knee every day,' says world champion Asher-Smith
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith says sporting excellence is how she shows her "vibrancy" as a black woman, as she prepares to start her 2021 season.

item.title: Premier League to trial concussion subs from 6 February
item.description: The Premier League and Women's Super League will trial the use of permanent concussion substitutes from 6 February.

item.title: Griffin stars as the Pistons hand the Lakers second successive defeat
item.description: The Los Angeles Lakers are beaten 107-92 by the Detroit Pistons as they lose consecutive games for the first time this season.

item.title: 100,000 Covid deaths: ‘I cursed the sterile white room where Ann died’
item.description: Already 100,000 people in the UK have died with Covid. This is the story of one of them.
